text: Juan Alberto Fuentes Knight is a Guatemalan economist, politician, and non- profit official. Among other roles, he has served as Minister of Finance in Guatemala and as chairman of Oxfam International.Juan Alberto Fuentes appointed chair of Oxfam International. Oxfam International. 10 April 2015. Fuentes is the son of Alberto Fuentes Mohr. He studied Economics at McGill University and the University of Toronto, and received his PhD from the University of Sussex.Juan Alberto Fuentes appointed chair of Oxfam International. Oxfam International. 10 April 2015. Fuentes has held positions with the United Nations in Costa Rica, Mexico, Chile, and Guatemala. He was founder and Director of the Central American Institute for Fiscal Studies (ICEFI), the first think tank of its kind in the region.Featured Speaker: Juan Alberto Fuentes Knight. World Bank Live. From 2008 to 2010, Fuentes served as Minister of Finance in Guatemala.Featured Speaker: Juan Alberto Fuentes Knight. World Bank Live. In this role, he steered the country's finances through the turbulent Great Recession, implementing moderate countercyclical policies to soften the impact of the global economic downturn.Guatemala: Letter of Intent. International Monetary Fund. 20 November 2009.Renuncia Ministro de Finanzas de Guatemala. El Economista. 23 June 2010. He also created a vice ministry dedicated to transparency in use of public funds.Featured Speaker: Juan Alberto Fuentes Knight. World Bank Live.La renuncia del Ministro de Finanzas guatemalteco. Central America Data. 24 June 2010. Alongside other initiatives, this new vice ministry spurred significant improvement in Guatemala's standing in the International Transparency Ranking, as the country moved up by 12 spots.Featured Speaker: Juan Alberto Fuentes Knight. World Bank Live.La renuncia del Ministro de Finanzas guatemalteco. Central America Data. 24 June 2010. After his time in office, Fuentes authored a popular book, Rendición de Cuentas (For Accountability), detailing his experiences while leading the Ministry.Rendición de cuentas, por J.A. Fuentes Knight. SOPHOS. 2 September 2011. Fuentes resigned as Minister of Finance in 2010, citing anomalies in the use of public funds and inability to pass a progressive fiscal reform.La renuncia del Ministro de Finanzas guatemalteco. Central America Data. 24 June 2010.Guatemala: Ex Post Evaluation of Exceptional Access Under the 2009 Stand-by Agreement. International Monetary Fund. October 2011, pg. 15.Renuncia de tres ministros abre crisis en gobierno de Guatemala. La Nación. 24 June 2010.Arrestan por corrupción al expresidente de Guatemala, Álvaro Colom. El Sol de México. 13 February 2018. He went on to serve as Regional Advisor of the UN Economic Commission for Latin America and the Caribbean (ECLAC) in Mexico City.Featured Speaker: Juan Alberto Fuentes Knight. World Bank Live. He then worked as Director of the Division of Economic Development at ECLAC in Santiago, Chile, where he conducted research on macroeconomic challenges and fiscal reform in Latin America and the Caribbean.Featured Speaker: Juan Alberto Fuentes Knight. Following this role, he taught courses in Economics at Universidad Rafael Landívar in Guatemala City, served as an independent consultant on economic integration and political economy, and participated in the organization of a new Guatemalan political initiative called Semilla.Featured Speaker: Juan Alberto Fuentes Knight. World Bank Live. On 13 February 2018, Fuentes was detained, alongside all other members of President Álvaro Colom's Cabinet, as part of a corruption investigation dating back to his time in government.Oxfam International chair held over Guatemala graft scandal. BBC News. 13 February 2018. The legal process is ongoing and he has not been convicted of any charges. He resigned the same day as president of Oxfam International.Chair of Oxfam International's Board of Supervisors, Dr. Juan Alberto Fuentes Knight, steps down. Oxfam International. 13 February 2018. Upon his resignation, Oxfam International's executive director, Winnie Byanyima, issued the following statement: “Oxfam does not yet know the nature of formal charges, if any, against Dr. Fuentes Knight. However, he has been entirely open with his Oxfam board and executive that he has been among former officials being investigated as part of a budgetary transaction made by the Guatemalan government while he was finance minister. He has assured us that he has cooperated fully with the investigation in the confidence he did not knowingly transgress rules or procedures.”Reaction to the arrest of Juan Alberto Fuentes Knight in Guatemala.
